Setup
You can easily contribute via github by following these steps:

â€œLow key contributionâ€: Just leave a comment on the article you want to enhance. This is especially wanted for general feedback (structure, content etc.)!
â€œI want to add notes myself!â€

No problem! Itâ€™s very easy, really. To get started, watch this video for 2 minutes and youâ€™re good to go!
Hereâ€™s a transcript of what to do:

Create a github account here!
Install git on your machine.
Go to the projectâ€™s website repository.
Fork it by clicking the button on the top right!
After linking the forked repo to your account, clone/download the files at your desired destination using:

git clone https://github.com/soekni/Special-Rcology.git
in your terminal/console. Make sure to open the terminal at your desired location or change the directory using the â€œcd locationToYourPathâ€.

Now youâ€™re good to go! Change/Add files/notes using Quarto. Check out this article for learning the basics of markdown to just get started! If you want to learn more about authoring content/styling, this is the article to go.



Further reading
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: The Idea
text:
The aim of this site is simple:
Gather up useful information on R, Ecology and Statistics here.
Use it as a â€œcheat sheetâ€ or digital garden for basic knowledge.
You can help by participating or pointing out mistakes by commenting.
